Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Three Stucco Masks from the Roman Era
Description: Three stucco masks produced in Egypt during the Roman era. One mask is of a man and on it a small plated area is still apparent. The second mask is also that of a man, his eyes are painted with black; it bears the remains of a forehead binding. The third mask is that of a small girl; painted with black hair hanging on her forehead. The hair has been combed starting from the middle of the head
